head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 4 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Didymus of Alexandria. Part of the chapters of Didymus of Alexandria against the Arians, from the 16th to the 26th.; Cyril of Alexandria. The twelve chapters of Cyril of Alexandria against the Nestorians; Cyril of Alexandria. The confession of faith of Cyril of Alexandria; Philoxenus of Mabūg. The confession of faith of Philoxenus of Mabūg; Part of a theologico-philosophical treatise.; ... In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 9 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Didymus of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the chapters of Didymus of Alexandria against the Arians, from the 16th to the 26th.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡܘ ܩ̈ܦܠܐܐ ܕܐܡܪܝܢ (sic) ܠܕܝܕܡܘܣ ܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܠܘܩܒܠ ܐܪ̈ܝܢܘ.

msItem.author: Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.title: The twelve chapters of Cyril of Alexandria against the Nestorians
msItem.rubric: ܪ̈ܫܐ ܬܪ̈ܥܣܪ ܕܗܝܡܝܘܬܐ ܕܐܡܪܝܢ (sic)ܠܘܩܒܠ ܗܪ̈ܣܝܘܛܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܢܣܛܘܪܝܣ. ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܩܘܪܝܠܘܣ ܪܫܐ ܕܐܦܣ̈ܩܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ.

msItem.author: Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.title: The confession of faith of Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.rubric: ܬ̣ܘܒ ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܩܘܪܝܠܘܣ ܪܫܐ ܕܐ̇ܦܣ̈ܩܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܩܘܪܝܠܘܣ ܏ܐܡ̇ܪ. ܡܗܝ̇ܡܢ ܐܢܐ ܒܐܒܐ ܘܒܒܪܐ̣ ܘܒܪܘܚܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ. ܒܐܠܗܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܫܬܕܪ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ. ܒܨܒܝܢܐ ܕܐܒܘܗܝ ܘܒܨܒܝܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ̣. ܘܒܨܒܝܢܐ ܕܪܘܚܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Philoxenus of Mabūg
msItem.title: The confession of faith of Philoxenus of Mabūg
msItem.incipit: ܡܗܝܡܢܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܒܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ̣ ܕܚܕ ܟܝܢܐ ܡܬܘܡܝܐ. ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ̣ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܠܝܬ ܒܗ ܩܢܘܡܐ ܕܛܠ̣ܐ ܘܕܩܫܝܫ. ܘܠܐ ܨܒܝܢܐ ܦܠܝܓܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: A section
msItem.incipit: ܐܘܣܝܐ ܡܬܦܠܓܐ̣. ܠܓܘܫܡܐ̣ ܘܠܠܐ ܓܘܫܡܐ. ܓܘܫܡܐ ܡܢܦܫܐ̣. ( sic) ܠܡ̇ܢܦܫܐ̣ ܘܠܠܐ ܡ̇ܢܦܫܐ܀ ܓܘܫܡܐ ܡܢ̇ܦܫܐ ܡܬ݀ܦܠܓ̣. ܠܚܝ̈ܘܬܐ̇ ܘܠܚܝܘܬ ܢܨ̈ܒܬܐ̣ ܘܠܢܨ̈ܒܬܐ.܀

msItem.title: Another section
msItem.incipit: ܐܘܣܝܐ ܕܒ̣ܪܝܐ ܓܢܣ ܓܢ̈ܣܝܢ. ܐܕܫܗ ܕܝܢ ܕܗܢܐ ܓܘܫܡܐ̣. ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ̣ ܓܢܣܐ ܕܐܕ̈ܫܐ. ܕܓܘ̈ܫܡܐ ܡܢ̈ܦܫܐ̣ ܐܘ ܠܐ ܡܢ̈ܦܫܐ. ܀ . ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: A third section
msItem.incipit: ܡܢܗܝܢ ܕܝܢ ܕܐܘܣ̈ܝܘܣ ܐܝܬܝܗܝܢ ܡܪ̈ܟܒܬܐ̣ ܘܡܢܗܝܢ ܦܫܝ̈ܛܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܡܡܠܠܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܕܥܠ ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ.

msItem.author: Philoxenus of Mabūg
msItem.title: Part of the twelve chapters of Philoxenus of Mabūg
msItem.incipit: ܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܫܟ̈ܝܚܢ ܒܡܫܝܚܐ. ܕܒܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܓܒ̈ܝܢ̣. ܟܠ ܚܕܐ ܡܢܗܝ̣ܢ ܓܡܝܪܬܐ. ܘܗ̣ܘ ܒܟܠ ܚܕܐ ܡܢܗܝ̣ܢ ܡܫ̇ܠܡܢܐ.
msItem.note: From the first to the third chapter, which is imperfect.

physDesc.p: Fifteen vellum leaves, about 9 ¼ in. by 5 7/8, some of which are slightly soiled and injured. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 27 to 31 lines. There are lacunae after foll. 6 and 9.

item.p: Fifteen vellum leaves, some of which are slightly soiled and injured. There are lacunae after foll. 6 and 9.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 27 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a neat, regular Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

head.note: This manuscript contains: John the Monk. The latter half of the fourth discourse, of John the Monk, addressed to Eusebius and Eutropius. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: John the Monk
msItem.title: The latter half of the fourth discourse, of John the Monk, addressed to Eusebius and Eutropius.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ: ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܒܚܝܪܐ ܕܠܩܘܫܬܝܢ: ܕܟܬܒܗ ܠܘܬ ܐܘܣܒܝܣ ܕܝܪܝܐ: ܒܫܘܐܠܐ ܘܒܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓܡܐ܀

physDesc.p: Six vellum leaves, about 9 ½ in. by 6 ½ . The writing is good and regular, of the viiith cent., with from 25 to 32 lines in each page.

layout.p: There are from 25 to 32 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the viiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The latter portion of a discourse on the physician and martyr Domitius. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

msItem.title: The latter portion of a discourse on the physician and martyr Domitius
msItem.rubric: ܕܘܡܛܝܣ ܣܗܕܐ̇. ܕܡܢ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܠܐ̈ܦܝ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܩܘܪܣ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ.

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, about 9 1/8 in. by 5 3/4, with from 20 to 23 lines in each page.

layout.p: There are from 20 to 23 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: Four vellum leaves written in a good, regular Estrangela of the viith or viiith cent.

msItem.author: Gregory the monk
msItem.title: Part 3
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܠܗ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܐܢ̈ܝܢ ܕܣܩ̈ܘܒܠܝܢ ܠܝܕܥܬܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ ܘܠܕܟܝܘܬܐ ܘܠܡܠܝܘܬܐ

physDesc.p: The first two and the last leaves are much stained and torn.

item.p: The first two and the last leaves are much stained and torn.

layout.p: There are from 26 to 29 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
